summary: mechanical ventilation may induce and exacerbate lung injury. biomarkers of ventilator-associated lung injury (VALI) are important for early diagnosis and prognosis. the precise function of each mediator remains to be elucidated. NGAL is easily detected in serum and bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) fluid (10,11) results indicated that NGAL levels increase in lung tissue, BAL fluid and serum during VALI in mice. NGAL may represent a novel diagnostic marker for the early prediction of patients at high risk of VALI. the protocol for low-volume for 2 h (LV-2) group was breathing under the condition of 6 ml/kg, 5 cm H2O PEEP for 2 h at 135 breaths/min. the protocol for high-volume for 4 h (LV-4) group was breathing under the condition of 6 ml/kg, 0 cm H2O PEEP for 4 h at 65 breaths/min. serum was collected via centrifugation at 1,000 g for 30 min at 4°C.
